description:
Chromoting Me2Me installation flow for Mac.


BUG=None
TEST=Manual

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=130800

messages.text:
sergey: Anything flow-related
jamie: Everything else

LGTM with one comment.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/main.html
File remoting/webapp/main.html (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/main.html#newcode255
remoting/webapp/main.html:255: <div class="message error-state"
Thinking about it, I'm not sure this is really an error. Maybe get rid of the error-state class?

LGTM when my nits are addressed.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js
File remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js#newcode86
remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js:86: remoting.setMode(remoting.AppMode.HOST_SETUP_INSTALL); } }
May be better to invoke hostSetupDialog method here that would change the mode. That way it would be more consistent with onInstallDialogOk().

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js
File remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js#newcode135
remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js:135: 'http://dl.google.com/chrome-remote-desktop/chromeremotedesktop.dmg';
Maybe move this to updateState_()? That's were we are supposed to start each step's action.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js#newcode244
remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js:244: } else if (state == remoting.HostSetupFlow.State.INSTALL_HOST) {
I tried to put these cases here in the same order in which they are defined in the enum, so this case should be between ASK_PIN and REGISTERING_HOST.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js#newcode437
remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js:437: remoting.HostSetupDialog.prototype.onInstallDialogOK = function() {
nit: should be onInstallDialogOk - lower case k

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js
File remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js#newcode86
remoting/webapp/event_handlers.js:86: remoting.setMode(remoting.AppMode.HOST_SETUP_INSTALL); } }
On 2012/04/04 20:32:22, sergeyu wrote:
> May be better to invoke hostSetupDialog method here that would change the mode.
> That way it would be more consistent with onInstallDialogOk().

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js
File remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js (right):

remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js:135: 'http://dl.google.com/chrome-remote-desktop/chromeremotedesktop.dmg';
On 2012/04/04 20:32:22, sergeyu wrote:
> Maybe move this to updateState_()? That's were we are supposed to start each
> step's action.

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9979023/diff/1/remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js#newcode244
remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js:244: } else if (state == remoting.HostSetupFlow.State.INSTALL_HOST) {
On 2012/04/04 20:32:22, sergeyu wrote:
> I tried to put these cases here in the same order in which they are defined in
> the enum, so this case should be between ASK_PIN and REGISTERING_HOST.

Done.

remoting/webapp/host_setup_dialog.js:437: remoting.HostSetupDialog.prototype.onInstallDialogOK = function() {
On 2012/04/04 20:32:22, sergeyu wrote:
